ranked_diseases.explanation: The patient's features (Macrodontia, Abnormality of the hand, Short stature, Delayed skeletal maturation) closely match those of the similar reference cases, all of which were diagnosed as KBG syndrome.
Coffin-Lowry syndrome can present with short stature, delayed skeletal maturation, and hand abnormalities, though macrodontia is less commonly reported.
Robinow syndrome can include short stature, hand abnormalities, and delayed skeletal maturation, but macrodontia is not a typical feature.
Weaver syndrome can present with advanced skeletal maturation (opposite of the patient's delayed maturation) and hand abnormalities, but macrodontia is not commonly associated.
